pullRequest.title: CB-8248: FreeIPA reboot flow finishes before instances reboot
pullRequest.bodyText:
Use combined stop/start operations in the FreeIPA instance reboot flow so that FreeIPA repair will wait for the AWS/Azure nodes to return to an actual running state. Currently, during a reboot operation, the AWS/Azure nodes always report a running state (this is so that the billing doesn't start billing a new session). With this fix, the reboot flow will actually finish. AWS will only bill for a minimum of 60 seconds each time a new instance is started.
See detailed description in the commit message.

nodes.bodyText: I am a little confused as to why there is an async stop followed by an async start. Does andThen() wait for the async to complete? If so, why even use async (unless it is referenced elsewhere).

nodes.bodyText: why did you introduce a new doStart? the old one is not used anymore
why do we need this new list of statuses? shouldn't the affectedVms fill the same purpose?
instead of passing affectedVms list to doStop and doStart it would be nicer if they return with a list and we can use that

I miss some action here. what happens here is:

issue stop for VMs which are running
collect the VM statuses
start VMs which are stopped

In theory all VMs should be stopped at the point we are collecting the statuses after stop. I think we should at least match that the requested VMs for reboot are all stopped and have a log here if any of them is not stopped

you have dropped polling here. are we sure about AmazonEC2Client#stopInstances and AmazonEC2Client#startInstances will return only after the state is changed to stopped/started? if not we might need some polling there
Thank you for the suggestion! I removed affectedVms. Also, the rebootedVmsStatus will be returned from doStart() method as suggested in another comment.
Thank you! I removed the line.

The reason to introduce new doStart() is we want to return the polling results from doStart(). The polling can take 1000 seconds total if blocking. In the case of a hang blocking call, we will wait twice as much long. It is not necessary to poll inside doStart() and then after return from doStart() immediately poll again. I also removed the old one.
doStop first parameter is never used, could you drop it?
doStart first parameter case is the same as doStop. could you drop it?

I think logInvalidStatuses would need some extra parameter which is also logged. Like "instances should be in STOPPED state" and here comes the list of instance ids and states. Otherwise we won't know if the log is coming from line 136 or 138.
Also logInvalidStatuses should log only one line, and not separate lines per instance. Could you fix that?

nodes.bodyText:
multiple issues here:

please don't use return like this, if possible avoid in the middle of returns in methods, or use else to indicate there are multiple exit points in the method
if you would like to check if a collection is empty, please use isEmpty()
I would negate the if condition and put the body of the method inside. You can use CollectionUtils from apache (CollectionUtils.isNotEmpty(instances)) or spring (!CollectionUtils.isEmpty(instances)) or write the whole condition by hand (instances != null && !instances.isEmpty()). It would still result in the same logic but there won't be that unnecessary return
